Context:
The Health Informatics graduate certificate program offered at George Brown College is designed for individuals who want to develop critical skills and competencies in health informatics and business system analysis. Some of the key areas of focus include healthcare systems, technologies, and trends, electronic medical records (EMRs), ethical and policy implications, problem identification and analysis, documentation and analysis of requirements, process modeling, project management, technical writing, leadership and management, and business and system analysis techniques.

Upon completion of the program, graduates will have essential skills and competencies for professional certification programs in Health Informatics and Project Management. Some of the skills they will acquire include formulating change strategies to implement health information systems technologies within healthcare settings, applying business and system analysis techniques to evaluate the effectiveness of HIST, designing and prototyping web and mobile health apps, integrating relevant standards and professional, ethical, and legislative requirements with health information system technologies, and configuring all aspects of an EMR used by physicians in outpatient settings and multidisciplinary clinics.

The program offers hands-on experience through case studies, industry projects, and practical work experience. Students will have the opportunity to gain practical experience using AryaEHR, a commercially available EMR, which is exclusive to George Brown College. For more information, visit AryaEHR's website.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2024/Health Informatics Program (Postgraduate) T402 | George Brown College2024.txt

Context:
The text mentions a college that offers a Business Analyst program and provides opportunities for Academic Membership in the International Institute of Business Analysis (IIBA) for students. Students who graduate from this program will be prepared to write the IIBA Entry Certification of Business Analysis designation.

The technology requirements for the program include a laptop with a minimum screen size of 13 inches, webcam and mic, 8 GB RAM, 256 GB SSD Hard Drive (512 GB is better), Quad-core i7 2.4GHz or better processor, 2 TB external hard drive, and consistent access to a reliable high-speed internet connection with a minimum download speed of 10 Mbs. The program delivery includes most courses taking place in the evening and on weekends, but some may take place from 2 PM - 6 PM on weekdays. Students have the option for a Work Integrated Project in semester 3 or co-op opportunities. Upon completion of the program, students will have skills needed for positions such as project/program coordinator, service desk analyst, product analyst, apps analyst, testing analyst, privacy co-ordinator, training co-ordinator, clinical informatics co-ordinator, data co-ordinator, and junior business analyst.

No specific year or email information was mentioned in the text.

Program Learning Outcomes:
- Assess organizational requirements for health information system technologies (HIST)
- Formulate strategies for the selection and implementation of HIST
- Design and deliver educational/training strategies for end-users
- Evaluate the impact of HIST on business/clinical processes, and on health services delivery

Context:
The text provides information on the fees, financial assistance, admission requirements, and application process for the George Brown College's program in Computer Technology (or a related field) for both domestic and international students.

Fees:
- Domestic students: Estimated fees do not include books or semester 3 co-op placement/work-integrated project fees of $500 each.
- International students: Should refer to the International Fees and Related Costs page for more information on fees.

Financial Assistance:
- The program is approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet OSAP eligibility criteria.

Admission Requirements:
- Domestic applicants require a minimum two-year diploma or bachelor's degree in Health Sciences or a related field, or a minimum three-year diploma in Information Technology or a related field.
- Applicants also need one year of work experience as a health-care professional or IT professional, or equivalent.
- International applicants with international transcripts need to provide English language proficiency test results and undergo an assessment from ICAS (International Credential Assessment Service) or WES (World Education Services).

Contact Information:
- Phone: 416-415-5000, ext. 4287
- Email: computertechnology@georgebrown.ca
- Website: georgebrown.ca

Application Process:
- Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.
- International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.
